Name: USER_SW
Notes: Connected to the PB6D input of the Crosslink FPGA.

Name: SDO_EN
Notes: Enables/disables the SDI loopback output of GS2971A, which is buffered and exposed on the 'SDI Output' BNC.

Name: AUDIO_EN
Notes: Enables/disables audio extraction fuctionality of GS2971A.

Name: IOPROC_EN
Notes: Enables/disables signal processing features of GS2971A like error correction and level conversion.

Name: 20bit_10bit
Notes: Used to select the output bus width. Must be set to low for proper operation on this board.

Name: SMPTE_BYPASS
Notes: When ON, GS2971A carries out SMPTE scrambling and I/O processing. When OFF, GS2971A operates in data pass-through mode.

Name: DVB_ASI
Notes: Enables/disables the DVB-ASI mode of GS2971A.

Name: SW_EN
Notes: When OFF, the default state of GS2971A's SW_EN pin is low. A rising edge (via switch or FPGA GPIO) will cause GS2971A to re-lock on the input video stream. Generally not needed unless the video source has been externally switched between two sources

Name: TIM_861
Notes: When ON, GS2971A outputs CEA 861 timing signals (HSYNC/VSYNC/DE) instead of H:V:F digital timing signals.

Name: RC_BYP
Notes: When ON, the serial digital output is the re-timed version of the serial input. When OFF, the serial digital output is simply the buffered version of the serial input, bypassing the GS2971A's internal reclocker.

Name: STANDBY
Notes: When ON, GS2971A is placed in a power-saving mode. No data processing occurs, and the digital I/Os are powered down.

Name: JTAG_HOST
Notes: When ON, the host interface port of GS2971A is configured for JTAG test. When OFF, GS2971A operates normally.
